properties.media:imagetext:
Wine List
The art of wine tasting is a unique individual experience.
Each one of us makes use of our different senses in order to appreciate a wine.
To help select the wine served to you, Thai Airways International has
invited renowned wine tasters from different parts of the world, namely,
Mr.James Mullen, Mr. Pairach Intaput, Mr Pierre Ouardes and Mr.Artur Kluczewski.
Each individual brings a wealth of achievement and experience to task of selecting
these wines, ensuring that each will be enjoyable and retain its qualities at altitude.
CHAMPAGNE
Lanson
The brilliant, limpid colour recalls the characteristic straw tones of
the Pinot Noir, with glints of amber. It is lively in the flute.
On the nose: It gives an impression of vitality and springtime scents.
In the mouth: Bouquets of ripe fruits and citrus create a sensation of plenitude and lightness.
RED WINE
Chateau Hanteillan Haut Medoc 2000
The wine has an intense purple colour with black tints. Complex nose of black berries
(blackcurrant and mulberry) and wooden aromas of roasted coffee and fresh butter.
Rich palate with round tannins good persistency. Beautiful balance.
Caves Des Moines Bourgogne Pinot Noir 2001
Medium ruby red with purple tinge. A fragant bouquet of fresh red fruits aromas
which also dominates on the palate with a subtle and moderate tannic back up.
WHITE WINE
Saint Véran 2001
Emerald-gold in colour, Saint Véran wines are dry but well-rounded, light, supple and fruity.
When young, they give off an aroma of pale-fleshed fruits and,
with age, the smell of hazelnuts, toasted almonds, honey and gunflint.
Riesling Grand Cru Altenberg 2003
Light yellow in colour. On the nose, a very floral bouquet,
delicate and subtle with citrus note. On the palate typical
Riesling with a long and fine acidity. Longfinish.
(Please accept our apology if your preference is not available.)
